intro: Schistogyne, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa and consists of several species, many of which are shrubs or subshrubs. The plants are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. Schistogyne species typically have narrow, linear leaves and produce small, capsule-like fruits. They are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
